intro: Ludwigia tepicana, commonly known as the Mexican willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ludwigia tepicana is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist to aquatic environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
